definition: blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees
blind
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract
variant of 摹[mo2]
elephant/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/shape/form/appearance/to imitate

sentences.english: Each sees a different part, like the blind men patting an elephant.
sentences.chinese: 就像盲人摸象，每個人都只看了不同的一部分。

sentences.english: The Buddha once told the story of the blind men and the elephant .
sentences.chinese: 佛陀曾經講過一個盲人摸象的故事。

sentences.english: Anybody ever hear of the story of the blind men and the elephant?
sentences.chinese: 估計每個人都聽說過盲人摸象的故事。

sentences.english: We are still, to a large extent, flying blind in conceptual terms.
sentences.chinese: 在經濟學觀念問題上，我們仍是盲人摸象。

definition: blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees
to touch an elephant (of proverbial blind people)
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
unable to see the wood for the trees/fig. only able to see isolated details, and not the bigger picture
pinyin: zhi3 jian4 shu4 mu4 bu4 jian4 sen1 lin2

definition: to know that it is so but not why it is so (idiom)
pinyin: zhi1 qi2 ran2 er2 bu4 zhi1 qi2 suo3 yi3 ran2
related.word: 知其然而不知其所以然

definition: lit. to see a leopard through a narrow tube (idiom); fig. to miss the big picture
the view of a frog in a well (idiom); fig. a narrow view
lit. drawing a tiger using a cat as a model (idiom); fig. to follow a model and get things more or less right but without capturing the spirit of the subject/uninspired imitation
lit. crossing the river by feeling for stones/improvise by trial-and-error/move cautiously
to wade across the river, feeling for footholds as one goes (idiom)/to advance cautiously, step by step/to feel one's way forward
pinyin: mo1 zhe5 shi2 tou5 guo4 he2

definition: lit. a notch on the side of a boat to locate a sword dropped overboard (idiom); fig. an action made pointless by changed circumstances
lit. to scratch the outside of the boot (idiom)/fig. beside the point/ineffectual
to copy the way they walk in Handan (idiom)/slavishly copying others, one risks becoming a caricature
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
lit. to know one and understand half (idiom); a smattering of knowledge/dilettante/amateur
to treat the symptoms rather than getting to the root of the problem (proverb)/reactive (rather than proactive)
pinyin: tou2 tong4 yi1 tou2 , jiao3 tong4 yi1 jiao3
